result.execSummary:
The defendant John Edwin Fowler Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. John Edwin Fowler Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • John Edwin Fowler Jr. was found guilty of Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

civilJdgmts.propDescr: Civil Judgment for unpaid court obligations.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes:
Pierce County Case will start immediately after the St Croix County case 16CF220 sentence. Sentence may be served in Dunn or Polk Co.
Consecutive to: St Croix County case 16CF220

9:19  Defendant John Edwin Fowler in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich  - on 16CF13 Plead to Ct 1.  - Probration 3 yrs consec. to St Croix Co case sentence in  16CF220 .    3 months  conditional jail    Dismiss Ct 2  of  Pierce County case16CF13.  Defendant pleads guilty to Ct 1 of 16CF13   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def    Constitutional rights explained to defendant
   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of Ct 1 and dismisses Ct 2. Court orders on Ct 1 16CF13 S/W Probation 3 years. Conditions 90 days jail,with huber with 3 days credit.Consecutive to St Croix Co 16CF220 sentence may be served in Dunn or Polk Co.  court costs, DNA sample and surcharge. Pierce Co sentence will start immediately consecutive to the St Croix Co. Case 16CF220 sentence   REMOVE THE DEFENSE ATTORNEY FROM THE CASE.

02:57   Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.  Atty Bub requests 10 days to file motions.  Court grants motion.    Court reads charges and possible penalties.   Defendant has a copy of the information  and waives reading of the information.   Defendant enters not guilty plea to both counts at preliminary hearing.   Not guilty pleas received by the court.   Pretrial Conference to be set.  Court reviews bond conditions with the defendant.

02:53 Defendant John Edwin Fowler in court with attorney Christopher R. Bub.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich calls Inv. Ducklow as a witness.  Inv. Ducklow is sworn in.  Froelich examines Inv. Ducklow.  Inv. Ducklow identifies the defendant.  Attyorney Bub examines Inv. Ducklow.   The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.

Defendant has copy of complaint.   Court reads charges and possible penalties.   Defendant waives reading of the complaint.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. O'Sullivan: requests $3000 signature bond.  Attorney Bub has no objection.  Court Orders $3000 signature bond.
